intro.speaker: Validar
intro.line: Remember, I want the Emblem in my hand and Emmeryn dead on the floor. Let nothing distract you from either purpose.

intro.speaker: Gaius
intro.line: Woah, woah, did I just hear that right? We're to KILL the exalt? I'm just here for the plunder. You know, line my pockets with some royal goods. The exalt's such a sweet lady... Sure, I'll rob her blind, but I'd never harm her!

intro.speaker: Emmeryn
intro.line: Chrom! Take Lissa and flee while you still have time!

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: No! We're not leaving you! Just stay where it's safe!

intro.speaker: Robin
intro.line: The assassins should scatter if we can defeat their leader.

intro.speaker: Validar
intro.line: Hmph! Two assassins and the little princeling was not even wounds? ...Wait. Some of these actors do not belong on this stage...

intro.speaker: Validar
intro.line: Ho ho! Can it be?! After years of searching... Tonight, fate truly piles gifts at my feet!

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Seems like nothing ever is with you.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Just stay at Emmeryn's door. We'll handle the killers.

cutscene.speaker: Marth
cutscene.line: I'm about to save your life. ...From him.

cutscene.speaker: Marth
cutscene.line: I trust this proof will suffice?

cutscene.speaker: Marth
cutscene.line: And quite the actress, too. Honestly, I'm surprised you didn't figure it out until just now.

battle.speaker: Emmeryn
battle.line: Chrom, please! Flee while you still can! You each have but one life, and I do not wish it weighed against mine!

recruit-talk.speaker: Panne
recruit-talk.line: I knew there was wisdom in slipping in with those rogues. Look at how these man-spawn claw at each other like savages! I will repay my warren's debt and then wash my hands of their race.

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: Another assassin?

recruit-talk.speaker: Marth
recruit-talk.line: Hold! Panne is not your enemy.

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: You know her?

recruit-talk.speaker: Marth
recruit-talk.line: I know... of her. And I knew she would come here tonight.

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: Quite the prophet, aren't you?

recruit-talk.speaker: Marth
recruit-talk.line: As you say. And I swear to you, Panne is an ally.

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: ...Good enough for me. All right, Shepherds! For now, we leave this Panne character be.

recruit-talk.speaker: Frederick
recruit-talk.line: Is that wise, milord?

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: Marth has earned our trust. She enjoys her secrets, I know. ...Like her gender, for one. But she's also saved our lives. Twice. And that's enough for me.

recruit-talk.speaker: Marth
recruit-talk.line: Chrom... Thank you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: Now, to the matter at hand: driving these scoundrels from our castle!

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: Drop your weapon, or die where you stand!

recruit-talk.speaker: Gaius
recruit-talk.line: Easy there, blue blood. I'm not here to hurt anyone.

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: ...Yet you run with a band of assassins?

recruit-talk.speaker: Gaius
recruit-talk.line: Believe it or not, just trying to make a living. I'm a thief, see? Bust open doors, crack into chests... that kind of thing. This lot said they wanted to break into some kind of vault. Nobody said anything about murder. I'd just as soon sit this one out.

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: Hmm... Then perhaps you'd be willing to prove your good intentions?

recruit-talk.speaker: Gaius
recruit-talk.line: Beg pardon?

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: We need all the help we can get to save the exalt's life. You appear capable, and we could use any information you have about our foes.

recruit-talk.speaker: Gaius
recruit-talk.line: Oh, right—those good intentions. Fine then, I'll prove my sincerity... if you sweeten the deal.

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: You want gold? ...Fine, you scoundrel. Let me just—oops.

recruit-talk.speaker: Gaius
recruit-talk.line: Looks like you dropped something. What's in the satchel, mmm?

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: Nothing—candies from my little sister. I'm sure you--

recruit-talk.speaker: Gaius
recruit-talk.line: "Candies"? As in, sugar candies?

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: Well... yes. I assume they'd be sweet? But--

recruit-talk.speaker: Gaius
recruit-talk.line: IT'S A DEAL!

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: ...You'll risk your life if I give you... a bag of candy?

recruit-talk.speaker: Gaius
recruit-talk.line: I said "sweeten the deal", didn't I? Don't get me wrong, I'll take the gold, too. Later. Unless you've got more of these. ...Have you got more of these?!

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: Um... I'll ask Lissa.

character-falls.speaker: Gaius
character-falls.line: Nngh... Damn and double damn... I hate it when things... go sour...

character-falls.speaker: Panne
character-falls.line: I have misjudged the strength of these animals... I must fall back...

character-falls.speaker: Marth
character-falls.line: Nngh, no! I must keep fighting...or what purpose have I served?

character-falls.speaker: Chrom
character-falls.line: Marth, no! Stand down! You'll die if you don't! We'll keep Emmeryn safe, I swear!

character-falls.speaker: Chrom
character-falls.line: Emm? ...EMM?! No, no, no, no, no! Oh gods, nooo!

boss.speaker: Validar
boss.line: Emmeryn was supposed to be an easy target... You will pay for interfering in my designs!

boss.speaker: Validar
boss.line: No... This is... all wrong... How could... you have known the plan...

boss.speaker: Validar
boss.line: Well, well... Ha ha ha! Oh, I know you... Submit to me, and perhaps I might honor you with the truth!

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Thank the gods you're safe!

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: It is you I have to thank, Chrom.

end.speaker: Phila
end.line: I beg your forgiveness, milord! I failed in my duty—they should never have made it into the castle in the first place.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Peace, Phila. You couldn't have known what was coming. Only Marth could...

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: ...Marth?

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Yes, I would speak more with... Um... Robin, where's Marth?

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: Hmm... An excellent question. She was here a moment ago...

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: ...Not again!

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Going somewhere? You have a bad habit of leaving without saying goodbye, you know.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Yes, I'm afraid I have a few bad habits.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Good ones as well—you saved my life, as well as both of my sisters. Is there some way I can repay you? Some favor I can grant?

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Hearing you offer is reward enough.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: But there must be something...

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: I already have what I came for: history has been rewritten.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: And what future averted?

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: After the exalt's untimely assassination, the Fire Emblem would be stolen. This, in turn, would lead to a great war, and soon to the end of mankind itself. ...But I'm sure that sounds like madness to you.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: ...Strangely, no. It doesn't. Somehow I know I can trust you. And I hope someday to repay your favors.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Perhaps one day you shall. Until then...

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: Brave taguel, there are not words enough to express my gratitude.

end.speaker: Panne
end.line: So you know our true name?

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: Sorry, what's a taguel?

end.speaker: Panne
end.line: I am a taguel. The... The last taguel. We are shape-shifters. Most of your kind calls us "beast" or "coney" in the midst of their hunt. I only helped because my warren owes Ylisse a debt. Do not think us friends, you and I!

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: I don't understand...

end.speaker: Panne
end.line: Yes, it's precious little your kind seem to understand. It was man-spawn like you that invaded our warren and slaughtered my people.

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: What?! Is this true? Who would do such a thing?

end.speaker: Panne
end.line: Ha! Do not act so shocked. You are all the same. Right down to your base desire to ruin and destroy all your touch—even each other.

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: ...There is truth to your words, perhaps. I'm told that, in taguel society, everyone is treated as an equal. Mankind could learn much from your warren. The words may come too late and mean too little, but I am deeply sorry. We have stolen your friends and family and made the world a lesser place.

end.speaker: Phila
end.line: Your Grace—you had no fault in this!

end.speaker: Panne
end.line: You claim to be blameless, and yet you would apologize? Pah! Your words are but wind.

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: I know... But they are all I have.

end.speaker: Panne
end.line: ...You seem sincere, man-spawn. You feel my pain as your own. ...I've never felt that before. Look at me. ...See what I am. I will never trust mankind. But you... Perhaps you truly are not like the others.

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: All I ask if a chance to earn your trust.

end.speaker: Validar
end.line: Nngh... How?! My purpose is too significant... to be thwarted... here... Aaargh...
Validar.

end.speaker: Validar
end.line: What? Who are you... Where did you... come from?
I am the power that compels you. You will not perish here. It is not written. You must live on to author a destiny greater than you know.

end.speaker: Validar
end.line: I-impossible! It can't be you! It can't be...
I am the wings of despair. I am the breath of ruin. I am the fell dragon, Grima...

end.speaker: Phila
end.line: It will take time to investigate how the assassination plot got so far. We have no leads at present.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: It was Plegia! I'm certain of it. They'd do anything for the Emblem. Emm, you can't stay here. Come to Ferox where it's safe.

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: And leave the people undefended? War is at our borders, Chrom. Do you expect Ylisse to stand against Plegia without a leader? They must know their exalt stands with them.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: But if something happens to you? What then?

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: Your Grace, perhaps you might relocate to the eastern palace for the time being? The other kingdoms would know nothing of it. You would be safer.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Yes, please. At least that. I can't leave for Ferox with you right in harm's way.

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: ...Hmm. Very well.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Thanks, Emm. I mean it. We'll escort you to the palace before we head north to the border.
